intro: Calvoa trochainii, commonly known as the Trochain's calvoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Calvoa trochainii is often found in moist, rocky habitats at higher elevations.
